titleStmt.title: Love in the blossome, or, Fancy in the bud containing a pretty, pleasant and delightful courtship betwixt two very young (but truly amorous) lovers, being persons of very eminent quality (at their first entrance into Cupid's school) : to the tune of Amarillis told her swain / J.P.
titleStmt.author: Playford, John, 1623-1686?

publicationStmt.publisher: For W. Thackeray, and W. Whitwood,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Playford. Cf. Wing.
